title: You-Know-What: Master of Fine Arts Thesis Exhibition by Emily Graves
description: Exhibition dates: March 17 – 30, Reception: Wednesday, March 19, 6-8pm.

title: It’s All the Rage: Activism, Aging, and the Raging Grannies of Madison
description: It’s All the Rage: Activism, Aging, and the Raging Grannies of Madison grows from a two-year archival and oral history project. This exhibit focuses on several decades of local Wisconsin grassroots activism enacted by the Madison and Dane County Raging Grannies. Featuring an array of granny hats, aprons, songbooks, political buttons, and instruments, as well as video and audio clips of their original songs, this exhibit explores how senior women have engaged in a wide variety of activities.
tags: Center for Design and Material Culture
Center for Research on Gender and Women

title: Constructs of Color—Hard & Soft
location: 9th floor Vision Gallery,Wisconsin Institutes for Medical Research
description: An exhibition exploring the multifaceted impacts of color, in works of translucent glass and stitched fabrics.- Stained glass works by Randy Glysch- Fiber, needlework, and mixed media stitchworks by Memory Cloth Circle artists

title: Addressing Team Breakdowns and Toxic Workplace Environments
description: In this session, you will discover how to identify breakdowns and toxic team environments. You’ll also explore what you can control, what you might influence, and what you may need to let go of when it comes to difficult group dynamics. Finally, you’ll uncover strategies to help you maintain your wellbeing when working with difficult individuals.

title: T&L Instructional Support Community
description: UW–Madison professionals who support instruction are invited to a spring event that continues our aspirations towards building community among this group. At this gathering, the T&L Instructional Support Community will provide visibility to about 10-12 of the teaching and learning support units on campus. You will have the opportunity to visit with these units to learn about their missions and work. This event is planned in alignment with one of our goals: “to deepen appreciation for T&L support units, their uniqueness, and commonalities.” It also allows us to continue working at the goal of “building or renewing relationships.”Lunch will be provided.Please registerso we know how many people to expect.

title: Licensure Workshop
description: If you are applying for licensure in WI, come join us as we all work on submitting your licensure application together.

title: Projecting Anxiety
description: Professor Ghenwa Hayek (University of Chicago) will explore the affective impact of a century of ongoing emigration on Lebanese culture (c. 1860-present) and the imaginaries and grammars that have been mobilized to express it. She will show how ‘Africa’ plays an oversized role in the Lebanese cultural imaginary of emigration.

title: Badger Scholars 1
description: For May 2026 grads. Badger Scholars is an academic and social support group to promote success in nursing. Based on feedback from fall semester topics for spring will include N323 support, information on organizations to become involved in, and NCLEX preparation questions.

title: Virtual Support for Survivors
description: This is a drop-in space for UW-Madison student survivors to connect with peers and offer mutual support in a confidential and safe environment. Group facilitators are mental health professionals that foster a space that is open, affirming, and connecting for all members. Group will focus on the impact of having experienced trauma and skills/supports to support post-traumatic growth, with some boundaries placed around sharing narratives about traumatic experiences. This group is specifically designed for UW-Madison students who have experienced sexual assault, dating/domestic violence, sexual harassment, stalking, and/or childhood sexual abuse.

title: Study Abroad 101
location: Study Abroad Resource Center, 301,Armory and Gymnasium (Red Gym)
description: Join us to learn the study abroad basics & how to plan ahead!We'll cover:• Academics abroad• Choosing a program• Funding tips (scholarships & financial aid)• Internship, research & fieldwork opportunities• & MORE!Register: bit.ly/3SiWBOg

title: AOS Colloquium Series – Dr. Asmeret Asefaw Berhe
location: 811 AOSS,Atmospheric, Oceanic and Space Sciences Building
description: Using insights derived from a combination of short- and long-term rainfall simulation experiments and field observation studies across California, plus theoretical work, this talk will discuss the effect of changes in the amount and timing of precipitation on fluxes, stocks, composition, and stabilization mechanism of soil carbon.

title: Russian Language Table
description: Open to all students interested in speaking Russian! Invite your friends and classmates and join us for conversation, games, tea parties and other activities that help you to practice Russian!

title: STEM Extension "Ask Me Anything" Session
description: You have questions, and we have answers! Join ISS Advisors for the i“Ask Me Anything” series, where you get answers to YOUR questions about F-1 work authorization / STEM Extension. This series will provide resources and information to quick questions you may have.Come prepared to ask questions! If you have a more complex question, you may be redirected to drop-in advising or encouraged to make an appointment with your advisor.

title: Rainbow Recovery Meeting with Badger Recover
description: The GSCC and Badger Recovery invite student members of the LGBT+ community to attend our All Recovery meeting. We offer a welcoming and judgment-free space where individuals can receive support and openly discuss their recovery journeys from substances, eating disorders, or addictive behaviors (i.e. alcohol use, eating concerns, self-harm, gaming). Meetings are facilitated by a staff member in recovery who aims to create a welcoming and inclusive environment for students at any stage in their recovery journey, whether they are questioning their relationship to a substance or addictive behavior, curious about recovery, or already in recovery.

title: The Money Behind March Madness: How Sports Betting is Redefining the Sports Industry
description: https://union.wisc.edu/events-and-activities/event-calendar/event/the-money-behind-march-madness-how-sports-betting-is-redefining-the-sports-industry

title: Photoshop 1: Essential Photo Editing with Photoshop
description: Adobe Photoshop is the industry-standard tool for digital image editing. In this workshop, students learn how to navigate the Photoshop interface, apply the fundamentals of digital photo correction and incorporate different tools and techniques to create a poster.Software Training for Students (STS) offers free technology classes for students. If you are a student and would like to attend this class, please enroll via the STS website (sts.doit.wisc.edu).
